results.title: Amlodipine, a long-acting calcium antagonist drug reduces ischemia-induced ventricular conduction delay in pig hearts.

results.title: Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: The effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lisinopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass and early to atrial filling peak velocity after 2 years of treatment were similar and these effects were already observed after 1 year of treatment.

citations.NLM: Beltman F, Heesen W, Smit A, May J, de Graeff P, Havinga T, Schuurman F, van der Veur E, Lie K, Meyboom-de Jong B. Two-year follow-up study to evaluate the reduction of left ventricular mass and diastolic function in mild to moderate diastolic hypertensive patients. J Hypertens Suppl. 1998 Oct;16(6):S15-9. PMID: 9856379

results.title: Echocardiographic changes and treatment goal rates after a 6-month combined treatment with amlodipine and losartan: a validation study in Andean countries (METAL study).
results.text_hl: The primary outcome was echocardiographic reduction of left @<m>DISEASE_Ventricular_Fibrillation</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014693 @@@ventricular@@@ mass (LMV) after 6 months of treatment.
